register.description: This register contains the K3_DSS revision number

bitfield.description: Module ID Field
RTL Revision
Major Revision
Minor Revision

register.description: This register controls various parameters related to software reset and IP idle

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0

Warm reset. Setting this bit to 1 triggers a module warm reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During read, it always returns 0. The warm reset keeps the configuration registers unchanged
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Software reset. Setting this bit to 1 triggers a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During read, it always returns 0
Internal clock gating strategy

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information

bitfield.description: Idle status of DISPC
Reset status of OLDI
Reset status of VP pixel clock domain
Reset status of DISPC Functional clock domain

register.description: End-Of-Interrupt register, to be used if pulse interrupts are used

bitfield.description: Write 1 to acknowledge a pulse IRQ

register.description: RAW Interrupt status. Raw status is set even if interrupt is not enabled. Write 1 to set the RAW status

bitfield.description: VID IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the VIDEO pipeline[s] interrupt events
VP IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the Video Port[s] interrupt events

register.description: Interrupt status. Enabled status, isn't set unless event is enabled. Write 1 to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced. RAW status also gets cleared, i.e. even if not enabled

bitfield.description: VID IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the VIDEO pipeline[s] interrupt events
VP IRQ STATUS. Register indicates the Video Port[s] interrupt events

register.description: SET Interrupt enable. Write 1 to set interrupt enable. Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register

bitfield.description: VID IRQ
VP IRQ

register.description: CLR Interrupt enable. Write 1 to clear interrupt enable

bitfield.description: VID IRQ
VP IRQ

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VID_0 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VIDL_0 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VID_0 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a clear a bit field

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VIDL_0 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a clear a bit field

bitfield.description: Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
Video End Window. This is raised by the DMA engine when the full video data has been sent to the pipeline
Video DMA Buffer Underflow. This is raised when the DMA buffer does not have the data requested by the Video pipeline

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VP_0 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation interrupt for OVR/VP. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost for Video Port
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP
Frame Done for Video Port. VP output has been disabled by user. All the data have been sent

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the VP_1 internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation interrupt for OVR/VP. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost for Video Port
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP
Frame Done for Video Port. VP output has been disabled by user. All the data have been sent

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VP_0 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation IRQ. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost on VP output. The required data are not output at the correct time due to too short blanking periods or stall of at least one pipelines associated with VP output
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field. For interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP output. It is used as VSYNC_EVEN in case of interlace mode
Frame Done for VP. VP output has been disabled by user All the data have been sent

register.description: This register groups all the status of the VP_1 internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: Dummy IRQ for future use
Go bit clear event
Security Violation IRQ. Non-secure OVR/VP connected to secure VID
Safety Feature IRQ. This is raised when FrameFreeze is detected or data mismatch occurs within the safety region
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero
Synchronization Lost on VP output. The required data are not output at the correct time due to too short blanking periods or stall of at least one pipelines associated with VP output
Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number
VSYNC for odd field. For interlace mode only
Vertical Synchronization for VP output. It is used as VSYNC_EVEN in case of interlace mode
Frame Done for VP. VP output has been disabled by user All the data have been sent

register.description: MFLAG control register

bitfield.description: MFLAG_START for DMA master port
MFLAG_CTRL for DMA master port

register.description: DISPC global output enable register. The ENABLE or GO bit for a particular output port is set when either the corresponding bit in this register is set or the corresponding bit within the sub-module is set. This register allows enabling multiple outputs synchronously [simultaneously], which is not possible if the ENABLE/GO bits are present only within the sub-module

bitfield.description: Global GO Command for the VP[2:0] output. It is used to synchronize the pipelines associated with the VP output. wr: immediate
Global VP[2:0] Enable

register.description: The register configures the DMA buffers allocations to the pipelines for DMA

bitfield.description: Controls if the DMA buffers are re-filled only when the LOW threshold is reached or if all DMA buffers are re-filled when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold
VIDL1 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines
VID DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines

register.description: This register contains CBA specific config bits in DSS

bitfield.description: Reserved : TI internal

The value sent out on the PRI_HI bus from DSS to CBA Indicates the priority level for high-priority [MFLAG] transactions. Value of 0x0 indicates highest priority Value of 0x7 indicates lowest priority
The value sent out on the PRI_LO bus from DSS to CBA Indicates the priority level for normal [non-MFLAG] transactions. Value of 0x0 indicates highest priority Value of 0x7 indicates lowest priority

register.description: DISPC debug status control register

bitfield.description: Mux select for the debug status
Enable debug ports

register.description: DISPC debug status register

bitfield.description: Debug status

register.description: Register to control clock gating at DISPC sub-module level

bitfield.description: Clock gating control for VP[2:0]
Clock gating control for OVR[2:0]
Clock gating control for VID
Clock gating control for DMA

register.description: Disable security settings throughout DSS IP. COMMON_1.DISPC_SECURE bits are honoured only if COMMON.DISPC_SECURE_DISABLE =0

bitfield.description: Secure disable bit
